review.title: Multi-criteria neutrosophic decision making method based on score and accuracy functions under neutrosophic environment
review.abstract: A neutrosophic set is a more general platform, which can be used to present uncertainty, imprecise, incomplete and inconsistent. In this paper a score function and an accuracy function for single valued neutrosophic sets is firstly proposed to make the distinction between them. Then the idea is extended to interval neutrosophic sets. A multi-criteria decision making method based on the developed score-accuracy functions is established in which criterion values for alternatives are single valued neutrosophic sets and interval neutrosophic sets. In decision making process, the neutrosophic weighted aggregation operators (arithmetic and geometric average operators) are adopted to aggregate the neutrosophic information related to each alternative. Thus, we can rank all alternatives and make the selection of the best of one(s) according to the score-accuracy functions. Finally, some illustrative examples are presented to verify the developed approach and to demonstrate its practicality and effectiveness.

metadata.title: Multi-criteria neutrosophic decision making method based on score and accuracy functions under neutrosophic environment

sections.text: Keywords: Neutrosophical sets Neutrosophical sets with uniform evaluation Interval neutrrosophical sets can be used to represent uncertainty, inaccuracy, incompleteness and inconsistency. In this thesis, a score function and an accuracy function for monovalent neutrosophical sets are first proposed to differentiate them. Afterwards, the idea is extended to interval neutrrosophical sets. A multi-criterion decision method based on the developed score accuracy functions is established, whose criterion values for alternatives are single-value neutrosophical sets and interval neutrrosophical sets. In the decision process, the neutrosophical weighted aggregation operators (arithmetic and geometric average operators) are used to aggregate the neutrosophical information in relation to each alternative. Thus, we can classify all alternatives and select the best aggregated approaches to demonstrate effectiveness.

sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text: This year, it has come to the point where there is only one person who is able to decide whether or not he will be able to seek another person.

sections.heading: 2. Preliminaries
sections.text: In the following we give a short review of some preliminaries.

sections.heading: 2.3 Interval neutrosophic sets
sections.text: In the following we present the definition of an INS (2,11) (26). − Let us specify a space of points (objects) and Int (0,1) in which all closed subgroups of [0,1],

sections.heading: 3. Ranking by score function
sections.text: In the following, we present a score function for ranking SVN numbers according to the degree of truth (= 0.0.2 = 0.6 degree of individuality, degree of indeterminacy and degree of indeterminacy of membership) (= 1 degree of indeterminacy, degree of indeterminacy and degree of indeterminacy of membership (= 2 degree of indeterminacy and degree of indeterminacy of membership), and discuss some basic characteristics. − Definition 3.18 Let = (,) be a single neutral number, a score function of a single neutral value based on the degree of truth, indeterminacy-degree and indeterminacy-degree is defined by () = 1 2

sections.heading: 5. Multi-criteria neutrosophic decision-making method based on the score-accuracy function
6. Comparison Analysis and Discussion
sections.text: In this section, we will perform a comparative analysis to validate the feasibility of the proposed decision-making method on the basis of precision score functions. To demonstrate the correlations, we will use the same examples taken from [32] and [30]. Score and accuracy functions are extremely important for the process of decision-making according to several criteria, but until now there have not been many studies on multi-criterion decision-making methods based on accuracy score functions, the criterion values for alternatives are single-value neutrosophic sets or interval neutrosophic sets. Ye [30] defined the similarity measures between INSs based on the relationship between similarity measures and distances and proposed the similarity measures between each alternative and the ideal alternative in order to establish a multi-criterion decision-making method for INSs. After Zhang et al. [6] presented a method based on the aggregation operators for multi-criterion distances and distances [suggested by the SVN], [suggested similarity between each alternative and the ideal alternative, in order to establish a multi-criterion decision-criterion method for INSs [6] decision-neutral conditions, the result proposed in the SVIVN is less predetermined in this section [30].

sections.heading: 7. Conclusions
sections.text: Currently, many technical score accuracy functions are applied to problems based on intuitionistic fuzzy information or interval-weighted intuitionistic fuzzy information, but they could not be used to solve the problems based on neutrosophic information. Therefore, this paper proposes two measurement functions that provide score and accuracy functions for monovalent neutrosophic numbers and interval neutrosophic numbers, and establishes a multi-criteriterial decision method based on these functions for neutrosophic information. In the decision process, the neutrrosophic weighted aggregation operators (arithmetic and geometric average operators) are used to aggregate the neutrosophic information associated with each alternative. Finally, some numerical examples are presented to illustrate the application of the proposed approaches.

Xu and Yager [23] defined some geometric aggregation operators named the intuitionistic fuzzy weighted geometric operator, the intuitionistic fuzzy ordered weighted geometric operator and the intuitionistic fuzzy hybrid weighted geometric operator, and applied the intuitionistic fuzzy hybrid weighted geometric operator to a multi-criteria decision making problem under intuitionistic fuzzy environment.
Then Xu [19] proposed the arithmetic aggregation operators which are arithmetic types of above mentioned ones.

Xu and Chen [20] generalized the arithmetic aggregation operators to interval valued intuitionistic fuzzy such that the interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy weighted geometric operator, the interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy ordered weighted geometric operator and the interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy hybrid weighted geometric operator, and applied the aggregation operators to a multi-criteria decision making problems by using the score function and accuracy function of interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy numbers.
The geometric aggregation operators for interval valued intuitionistic fuzzy sets are also proposed in [18].
Ye [30] proposed a multi-criteria decision making method for interval neutrosophic sets by means of the similarity measure between each alternative and the ideal alternative.
Also, Ye [31] presented the correlation coefficient of SVNSs and the crossentropy measure of SVNSs and applied them to single valued neutrosophic decision-making problems.

[6] established two interval neutrosophic aggregation operators such as interval neutrosophic weighted arithmetic operator and interval neutrosophic weighted geometric operator and presented a method for multi-criteria decision making problems based on the aggregation operators.

Ye [30] defined the similarity measures between INSs based on the relationship between similarity measures and distances and proposed the similarity measures between each alternative and the ideal alternative to establish a multi criteria decision making method for INSs.
[6] presented a method based on the aggregation operators for multi criteria decision making under interval neutrosophic environment.
By obtaining the different results than given in [30], they showed that the method proposed is more precise and reliable than the result produced in [30].
By obtaining the different results than given in [30], they showed that the method proposed is more precise and reliable than the result produced in [30].

Although the same ranking results with [6] are obtained in here, the decision making method proposed in this paper has less calculation and it is more flexible and more sustainable for the multi criteria decision making with SVN or IVN information.

metadata.abstractText: A neutrosophic set is a more general platform, which can be used to present uncertainty, imprecise, incomplete and inconsistent. In this paper a score function and an accuracy function for single valued neutrosophic sets is firstly proposed to make the distinction between them. Then the idea is extended to interval neutrosophic sets. A multi-criteria decision making method based on the developed score-accuracy functions is established in which criterion values for alternatives are single valued neutrosophic sets and interval neutrosophic sets. In decision making process, the neutrosophic weighted aggregation operators (arithmetic and geometric average operators) are adopted to aggregate the neutrosophic information related to each alternative. Thus, we can rank all alternatives and make the selection of the best of one(s) according to the score-accuracy functions. Finally, some illustrative examples are presented to verify the developed approach and to demonstrate its practicality and effectiveness.
